dungeonette.domain

Class Floor

  • java.lang.Object
    • dungeonette.domain.Floor

  • public class Floor
extends java.lang.Object
    Floor is an object class which is used to store the information for a single dungeon floor. Proper setters and getters to be implemeneted, so the class is not 100 % encapsulated. The class contains program logic which should be refactored into separate classes.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Floor

        public Floor(Specification spec)
        Constructor for the floor. Note that the object is constructed WITHOUT the pointOfEntry object.
        Parameters:
        spec - Specification object of the dungeon

    • Method Detail

      • addSaltToGrid

        public void addSaltToGrid()
        "Salt" refers to coarse grid locations where no rooms can be placed. The density of salt has a huge impact on the dungeon's looks. Passageways ARE legal on salted grids.

      • removeSalts

        public void removeSalts()
        Removes all salts from the floor. Used in debugging, might have further uses as well.

      • storeRoomsIntoTiles

        public void storeRoomsIntoTiles()
        Prints the room placement while storing the tiles into the char array. Passages between the rooms are not yet carved out.

      • getTiles

        public char[][] getTiles()
        Returns two dimensional array of char tiles of the floor.
        Returns:
        two dimensional array of char tiles of the floor.

      • getItems

        public char[][] getItems()
        Returns two dimensional array of char items of the floor.
        Returns:
        two dimensional array of char items of the floor.

      • addRandomRoute

        public void addRandomRoute(boolean connecting)
        Adds a random passageway to the dungeon. The passageway always is connected FROM an existing room. If the connecting parameter is FALSE, then the passageway is generated as a deadend.
        Parameters:
        connecting - true if the route connects to another room, false if the route is a deadend

      • addCrossyPassage

        public void addCrossyPassage(java.awt.Point start,
                             char dir)
        Calling this method adds a crossing passageway to the specified location. The crossing passageway should result as a dead-end (terminate before breaching any room outer boundary walls). Crossy passage tiles are marked as ¤+ in the dungeon printouts.
        Parameters:
        start - starting coordinates of the crossed passageway
        dir - direction of the MAIN passageway (not the crossing passageway!!!!!)

      • getRoomQueue

        public RoomQueue getRoomQueue()
        Method for calling for the queue of active rooms
        Returns:
        returns the queue

        public int getRoutes()
        Number of routes stored for the floor
        Returns:
        number of routes

        number of rooms on the floor

        number of rooms

        array of points

      • addRouteCount

        public void addRouteCount()
        increments the route counter

      • getTileIDs

        public int[][] getTileIDs()
        If the tile is identifiable to specific room, this matrix stores it's number. Zeroes refer to tiles which DON'T belong to rooms.
        Returns:
        matrix of integer id's

      • getRouteIDFrom

        public int[] getRouteIDFrom()
        Routes are identified by origin room and destination room id numbers This method returns an array id numbers of the room from which the psassageway originates from.
        Returns:
        id numbers

      • getRouteIDTo

        public int[] getRouteIDTo()
        Routes are identified by origin room and destination room id numbers This method returns an array id numbers of the room for which the psassageway destines to.
        Returns:
        id numbers

      • getDoorTiles

        public char[][] getDoorTiles()
        A placeholderish method which returns a char array containg door locations
        Returns:
        char array of door locations

      • setPointOfEntry

        public void setPointOfEntry(java.awt.Point pt)
        Sets the point of entry (the first room) of the floor. After the point is set, the salt is added.
        Parameters:
        pt - grid coordinate of the first room of the floor
